Name of the corresponding LOB index partition
Position of the LOB data partition within the LOB item
Indicates whether the partition is composite (YES) or not (NO)
Value of the CHUNK attribute of the LOB data partition
Value of the PCTVERSION attribute of the LOB data partition

Indicates whether and how the LOB data is to be cached in the buffer cache:

  • YES - LOB data is placed in the buffer cache

  • NO - LOB data either is not brought into the buffer cache or is brought into the buffer cache and placed at the least recently used end of the LRU list

  • CACHEREADS - LOB data is brought into the buffer cache only during read operations but not during write operations
Indicates whether the STORAGE IN ROW attribute is enabled for the LOB data partition (YES) or not (NO)
Name of the tablespace containing the LOB data partition
Size (in bytes) of the initial extent of the LOB data partition, or DEFAULT
Size (in bytes) of secondary extents of the LOB data partition, or DEFAULT
Minimum number of extents allowed in the segment of the LOB data partition, or DEFAULT
Maximum number of extents allowed in the segment of the LOB data partition, or DEFAULT
Maximum number of blocks allowed in the segment of the LOB data partition, or DEFAULT

Retention option.

Possible values for a SecureFiles segment:

  • NONE

  • AUTO

  • MIN

  • MAX

  • DEFAULT

  • INVALID

Possible values for a BasicFiles segment:

  • YES

  • NO
Minimum retention duration for a SecureFiles segment, or DEFAULT
Percentage increase in extent size for the LOB data partition, or DEFAULT
Number of process freelists allocated in the segment of the LOB data partition, or DEFAULT
Number of freelist groups allocated in the segment of the LOB data partition, or DEFAULT

Indicates whether or not changes to the LOB are logged:

  • NONE - Not specified

    See Also: the *_LOB_SUBPARTITIONS view

  • YES

  • NO

Buffer pool for the LOB partition blocks:

  • DEFAULT

  • KEEP

  • RECYCLE

  • NULL

Database Smart Flash Cache hint to be used for partition blocks:

  • DEFAULT

  • KEEP

  • NONE

Solaris and Oracle Linux functionality only.

Cell flash cache hint to be used for partition blocks:

  • DEFAULT

  • KEEP

  • NONE

See Also: Oracle Exadata Storage Server Software documentation for more information

Indicates whether or not the LOB is encrypted.

Possible values for SecureFiles:

  • YES

  • NO

Possible value for BasicFiles:

  • NONE - Not applicable

Level of compression used for this LOB.

Possible values for SecureFiles:

  • LOW

  • MEDIUM

  • HIGH

  • NO - Compression is off

Possible value for BasicFiles:

  • NONE - Not applicable

Kind of deduplication used for this LOB.

Possible values for SecureFiles:

  • LOB - Deduplicate

  • NO - Keep duplicates

Possible value for BasicFiles:

  • NONE - Not applicable
Indicates whether the LOB is SecureFiles (YES) or not (NO)
Indicates whether the LOB partition segment has been created (YES) or not (NO); N/A indicates that this LOB is subpartitioned and no segment exists at the partition level
